Package Player_class

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player_class.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
NPC, PC
public abstract class Player extends Object
This is the base (and abstract) class from which the PC and NPC classes are derived. By declaring Player 1 (p1 variable) and Player 2 (p2 variable) as Player class type, then even when they are constructed as PC class and NPC class objects (each player could be either and type is not known until runtime) they can still be passed to all methods expecting objects of Player class type. This is the biggest secret of the whole program, and the heart of its design. This allows the two players to be ANY combination of computer or human controlled objects (NPC or PC classes, respectively). Some explicit type casting is still needed in places to make the whole thing work.
Author:
Jonathan Wayne Edwards on Monday 8 May 2023

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Default constructor. Should not be called

    • Player

      public Player(boolean human, String name)
      The workhorse constructor for making PC and NPC objects.
      Parameters:
      human - Is this object human or not? (True for making PC objects, false for NPC objects.)
      name - The name of the object.

  • Method Details

    • makePCPlayer

      public static Player makePCPlayer(boolean human, String name, Scanner scnr)
      Makes a PC object.
      Parameters:
      human - Is this Player object controlled by a human? True.
      name - The object's display name.
      scnr - The only Scanner in the program. Passed in.
      Returns:
      Returns the newly instantiated PC object, cast as Player type.

    • makeNPCPlayer

      public static Player makeNPCPlayer(boolean human, String name, Random rnd)
      Makes an NPC object.
      Parameters:
      human - Is this Player object controlled by a human? False.
      name - The object's display name.
      rnd - The only Random class object in the program. Passed in.
      Returns:
      Returns the newly instantiated NPC object, cast as Player type

      Gets the number of wins
      Returns:
      int number of wins in the match. One match per program execution.

    • addWin

      public void addWin()
      Increases this object's number of wins by 1.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Gets this object's score so far in a game
      Returns:
      int of the score of this object within a Gen_RPS_Game

    • incScore

      public void incScore()
      Increases score by 1.

    • incScore

      public void incScore(int addPoints)
      Increases this object's score by a number of points. Not utilized yet, with only 2 Player objects. Will be used when more Player objects are implemented
      Parameters:
      addPoints - int number of points to add to this object's score.

    • decScore

      public void decScore()
      Decreses the score by 1. Not used in a 2 Player game.

    • decScore

      public void decScore(int removePoints)
      Decreases this object's score by a number of points. Not utilized yet, with only 2 Player objects. Will be used when more Player objects are implemented
      Parameters:
      removePoints - int number of points to remove from this object's score.

    • resetScore

      public void resetScore()
      VERY IMPORTANT. Resets this object's score to 0, for a new game. Called when a new instance of Gen_RPS_Game is created.
